"And heaven and nature sing, and heaven and nature sing, and heaven and heaven and nature sing"
"No crib for a bed, the little Lord Jesus laid down His sweet head"

1.title: LET IT SNOW, LET IT SNOW, LET IT SNOW
clues: Flat snow crystals generally have this many sides or arms

When air becomes "super" this adjective, relative humidity is above 100% & snow can form

4.title: O COME, ALL YE FAITHFUL

6.title: WHERE IN LONDON AM I?
clues: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from the Sherlock Holmes Museum.) I'm standing in front of the Sherlock Holmes Museum, a Victorian lodging house built in 1815, on this famous London street
(Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from a London square.) I'm in this London square associated with Virginia Woolf, who was at the center of a group that made this area famous
(Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from a London street.) Read all about it!  Behind me is this London street that has become synonymous with British journalism
(Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Hyde Park.) Winston Churchill & George Bernard Shaw are among those who've come to say their peace at this spot in Hyde Park
(Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from a London park.) This famous London park is named for the title of the future George IV and was designed by his friend John Nash

11.title: SPLIT INFINITIVES
